name: Tuna and Peas
author: Herb Brooks
summary: This recipe is quick and easy; my children love it. Serve over toast, biscuits, or rice. It's good for breakfast or brunch.
ingredients: 1 (10.75 ounce) can  condensed cream of mushroom soup
½ cup milk, or as needed
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat
Saute peas, onion, and garlic in hot butter until onion is translucent, 5 to 7 minutes
Pour mushroom soup over the peas mixture; add enough milk to the mixture to thicken the soup to the point of there being no lumps
Flake tuna and add to the skillet; season with salt and pepper
Cook until the mixture is warm and bubbly, about 10 minutes
